title: Find constant variables with float values using Ghidra
content:
I dumped an il2cpp.so with il2cppDumper and in the dump.cs I found that the variables I wanted to change its values are somewhat constant float. this is the snippet:

// Namespace: 
public class GameConfig // TypeDefIndex: 6152
{
    // Fields
    public const float durationSlide = 1.2; // 0x0
    public const float durationBlockDame = 0.1; // 0x0
    public const float forceOnBreak = 2000; // 0x0
    public const float durationBombExp = 1.8; // 0x0
    public const float durationUpdateDistance = 0.1; // 0x0
    public const float durationCheckRange = 2; // 0x0

    // Methods
    // RVA: 0x3F5E98 Offset: 0x3F5E98 VA: 0x3F5E98
    public void .ctor() { }
}

And then loaded the lib into ghidra and then auto analyze command, while in my understanding those variables could be in that .rodata section but needed help of how can I identify those values like for example 1.8 which equals in hex 0x3fe66666 tried to search those values but not able to get it. on the .rodata section contained so much data like this:

                                                  //

such data, tried using terminatedCstring option but still didn't do on all of it. because these are so much and don't know easy way to do this.

btw how can I search through and get the value 1.8 in the binary?

Edit : such long days and no answer I had the feeling to share the apk game I was trying to reverse engineer. Hope it helps.
